results.101-106: Handwraps of Mighty Blows (+2 greater striking)

results.66-71: PFS Standard Magic Weapon (+3 greater striking)
results.84-89: Handwraps of Mighty Blows (+3 greater striking)

results.67-72: Handwraps of Mighty Blows (+3 major striking)

Deck of Illusions Cards.name: Deck of Illusions Cards
Deck of Illusions Cards.description: Potential illusions drawn randomly from the deck. The card is destroyed on use.

Deck of Many Things.name: Deck of Many Things
Deck of Many Things.description: These 22 cards of heavy vellum, usually stored in a box or a pouch, bear images or glyphs depicting symbols of magical power. Looking at a card without activating it shows the card face but has no magical effect. Once the deck is face down, the cards randomize themselves-if you look at the top card multiple times, you may find it changes. Any card removed from the deck goes missing after a few seconds, reappearing in the deck.

results.1-1: Balance. Your alignment changes to a radically different one. If you fail to adhere to that alignment, you lose a level and all the benefits you gained at that level. Your XP total doesn't change when you lose a level this way.
results.2-2: Comet. If you alone defeat the next low-threat or harder hostile enemy or enemies you encounter, you gain enough XP to reach the next level. Otherwise, you gain no benefit.
results.3-3: Donjon. You're imprisoned by a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2CNqkt2s2IYkVnv6]{Imprisonment} ritual. This uses the prison option, typically sequestering you in a distant part of the world. You also lose all your items. Cease drawing cards.
results.4-4: Dullard. Immediately reduce your Intelligence score by [[/r {1d4+1} #Dullard Intelligence Decrease]]{1d4+1}. You can then draw an additional card, and the Dullard card then disappears forever.
results.5-5: Euryale (curse). A medusa's image curses you with a permanent -1 status penalty to all saving throws. This can be removed by only a deity or the Fates card. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.8ersuvNJXX00XaIQ]{Effect: Euryale (Curse) Card}
results.6-6: The Fates. The Fates respin the fabric of reality to save you from any situation you choose. This can reverse even a past event, and you can make the decision instantly even if the event would slay you. This intervention saves only you, not anyone else affected by the event. There's no limit on how long you can wait before using this effect.
results.7-7: Flames. A fiend becomes filled with anger, jealousy, envy, or some other reason to despise you. Its hatred for you doesn't cease until either it or you is dead. It attacks you or otherwise attempts to foil you within [[/r 1d20 #days]]{1d20 days}. The GM determines the specifics of the fiend.
results.8-8: Fool. You lose [[/r 1d10*100 #XP]]{1d10*100 XP} unless you choose to draw two more cards.
results.9-9: Gem. Gain your choice of 25 pieces of jewelry worth 200 gp each or 50 gems worth 100 gp each.
results.10-10: Jester. You can either draw two more cards or gain [[/r 1d10*100 #XP]]{1d10*100 XP}. The card then disappears forever.
results.11-11: Key. Gain a magic weapon of 12th level or higher. The GM determines the item and what runes it has, if any.
results.12-12: Knight. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-npc-core.Actor.94fOoBeUT8PgTywH]{Palace Guard} arrives and swears unfailing loyalty to you.
results.13-13: Moon. Roll [[/r {1d4} #Wishes]]{1d4} to determine how many wishes the card grants you, which also affects the phase of the moon depicted on the card (1: crescent moon; 2: half moon; 3: gibbous moon; 4: full moon). These wishes each take one action to speak and have the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell.
results.14-14: Rogue. One NPC ally becomes filled with hatred and immediately turns against you forever. The NPC might keep this hatred secret until an opportune moment.
results.15-15: Ruin. You lose all your nonmagical possessions, including any wealth and property.
results.16-16: Skull. You must immediately battle a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.WoICHri7raCYv1wU]{Lesser Death}. If slain in the battle, you can never be revived, except by a deity.
results.17-17: Star. Gain an ability boost you must use immediately on one ability score of your choice.
results.18-18: Sun. Gain 1,000 XP and a beneficial permanent magic item of 6th to 11th level, chosen by the GM.
results.19-19: Talons. All your magic items disappear permanently, except for the deck and any artifact of higher level than the deck.
results.20-20: Throne. You gain a permanent +4 status bonus to Diplomacy checks, and you now own a small castle in any open area you wish. You must choose its location within 1 hour.  @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.Zb8RYgmzCI6fQE0o]{Effect: Throne Card}
results.21-21: Vizier. Upon request, you can learn the solution to any one problem or the correct answer to any one question, unless that information is obscured by a deity. This doesn't necessarily give you the means to act on that solution. You have 1 year to take the vizier's advice or lose its benefits.
results.22-22: The Void. Your mind becomes trapped forever. This card is fickle, but it often throws the psyche into a prison in an object on a distant plane or planet. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or similarly powerful magic can reveal your psyche's location, but it doesn't bring you back. Your comatose body continues to function. Cease drawing cards.

results.11-15: Original manuscript from a world‑famous author
results.26-30: Jet and white gold game set
results.36-40: Gold urn with scenes of judgment
results.51-55: Gold mask of a high priest

results.51-55: Chrysoberyl symbol of an evil eye

results.1-1: You spin just like the top. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.
results.4-4: A 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} makes you look like the target.
results.5-5: A statue of the target, made of chocolate or candy, appears adjacent to you.
results.6-6: Gravity reverses, sending you and the target 30 feet in the air, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. You both fall at the start of your next turn.
results.7-7: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC]{Mind Reading} affects the target, and the top loudly recites what it discovers.
results.9-9: A fountain erupts from the top, spraying wine for 10 minutes.
results.10-10: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} affects you, but you teleport through Hell.
results.12-12: Four singing skeletons appear to serenade you and your allies for 1 minute, granting a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks.
results.13-13: The top flings 1 cp at you.
results.15-15: You and the target change places; this is a teleportation effect.
results.16-16: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} affects the target, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DCQHaLrYXMI37dvW]{Paralyze} if the target's on its home plane.
results.17-17: Rainbow dye explodes and covers you for 24 hours.
results.18-18: The top creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MlpbeZ61Euhl0d60]{Toxic Cloud} centered on the target.
results.19-19: A random unattended object within 60 feet of you sprouts animal legs and follows you, reverting when the top's activation recharges.
results.20-20: Spin again, and the target also spins as though it had activated the top.

results.11-15: Previously lost volume from a legendary author
results.41-45: Platinum image of a fey noble with a bit of orichalcum
results.56-60: Living flame shaped into a phoenix
results.71-75: Divine art piece created by Shelyn
results.81-85: Enormous chryselephantine sculpture by a legend

results.46-50: Enormous tapestry of a major battle
results.61-65: Coral idol of an elemental lord
results.81-85: Small cold iron cauldron with onyx

results.1-3: [Landmark] A feature of some significance that distinguishes the hex as noteworthy.
results.4-6: [Secret] The hex contains a secret the party uncovers upon exploring the hex.
results.7-9: [Resource] The hex contains some valuable resource appropriate to the terrain.
results.10-20: [Standard] A standard representation of the terrain type.

Rod of Wonder.name: Rod of Wonder
Rod of Wonder.description: This peculiar rod is strange and unpredictable. Each time it is activated, it produces one of a variety of effects at random.

results.1-3: Leaves grow from the target; they last 24 hours
results.10-13: A stream of 600 large and colorful butterflies pours forth, fluttering in a 20-foot burst for 2 rounds; creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} while in the cloud of butterflies
results.14-15: All the target's weapons animate with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DCPsilr8wbPXxTUv]{Dancing} rune
results.26-29: Grass grows in a 60-foot cone in front of the rod, or existing grass grows at 10 × normal rate
results.30-30: Target turns blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration
results.32-34: Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius around you for 1 round
results.39-39: Summon an ineffective mouse (1st-level summon animal)
results.43-44: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image} on you
results.47-48: The non-living, unattended object closest to the target (up to 30 cubic feet in size) turns ethereal for an unlimited duration
results.54-54: You turn blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration
results.55-59: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} on you, lasting [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}
results.60-61: [[/r 1d4*10 #gems]]{1d4*10 gems}, each worth 1 sp, shoot from the rod, dealing @Damage[1[piercing]]{1 piercing damage} to each creature in a 15-foot cone
results.78-80: Roll again; the target believes you created the effect of the second roll
results.85-87: Target is coated in nectar, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round
results.98-100: The rod casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} on you, lasting 1 day

Warpwaves.name: Warpwaves
Warpwaves.description:
Many proteans can subject their foes to disorienting alterations perceived in time and space by creating ripples of unstable reality in the environment called warpwaves.

When a creature fails its saving throw and is affected by a warpwave, roll 1d8 and consult the table below for the specific effect on that creature.

Unless indicated otherwise, a warpwave effect lasts for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and a new warpwave effect negates any previous warpwave effect already affecting a creature.

results.2-2: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and gains [[/r 4d6 #Temporary Hit Points]]{4d6 temporary Hit Points}
